boardgame.name: Tank Leader Terrain Tile Pack
boardgame.description:
Expansion pack for Sherman and Tiger Leader games.

This expansion includes Terrain Tiles for Europe, Winter, Desert, and Jungle. It also includes 4 new Terrain types: Roads, Rivers, Bogging, and Outposts and a rules sheet for new terrain types.

This new terrain will allow for different scenario layouts in either the Sherman Leader or Tiger Leader games.

boardgame.name: Antsy!
boardgame.description:
A Fast-paced fun game to get rid of "those ants in the pants."

Each player is assigned a pair of pants on the game board. They are also given 10 ants to put in their pants. The players then move around the board and are given activities which help get rid of the ants.

The first player to "get rid of" their ants wins the game. The game plays fast and children want to play Antsy time after time.

boardgame.name: Nulukkhur
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The town sits upon a mountainous crag, accessible by a single bridge. Nulukkhur was once a prosperous and wealthy trading post between the dwarf clans of the Smoking Mountains and the humans and gnomes of the midlands. Human, Gnomish and Dwarven traders all set up offices here and the town market used to be a bustling and crowded place. Part of the town clings to the cliffside and part of the town is actually built inside of the mountain.

Inside the mountain you will find the homes, forges and clan halls of the dwarven inhabitants as well as mercantile offices, city offices, the fortress of the town watch and many homes of the very wealthy which extend upwards outside of the mountain in vast towers of luxury and security.

The exterior of the mountain is covered in homes clinging to the cliffside as well as numerous walkways and rope bridges that connect the many levels of the outer city. The Market is a large wooden deck secured with ropes and spikes into the mountainside. The King and Blade Tavern as well as a few shops can be found in the outer city near the market.

It is governed by an arcane sorcerer, a female gnome named Sanzur. Since Sanzur took over the running of the town many of the wealthy merchants have steered lcear of the volitile little gnome. Sanzur was once an adventurer and decided to retire in Nulukkhur. She bought the largest tower home in the city and convinced the old mayor to turn over the town to her. She has been known to use magic on those who have crossed her in the past though some of her enemies have simply vanished or had nasty falls from one of the town's rope bridges.

boardgame.name: Pedale
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This small outpost is surrounded by a wooden palisade which protects it from external enemies. Inside the town other wooden walls seperate the town into five small districts. The central area around a giant statue of a hideous demon figure is the hub of the town. The rest of the town is divided into four equal quadrants along the cardinal directions.

The nearby city of Amber was abandoned by the Elves centuries ago and has lay in ruins undisturbed for decades. Recently Raffolk and the Five Hands Company has been sending in expeditions to search the ruins for valuable treasures and magical relics. The elves in town are upset about this blatent sacking of their once cherished city and have been sending in their own expeditions to secure valuables before everything is stolen by the humans in town.

In the center of Amber is an extraplanar gateway that has lay open for a long time. The gateway sends forth demons from another plane on an irregular basis. The large statue in the center of Pedale magically prevents the demons from attacking the town. Many bands of explorers and warriors have been lost to the demons in the old city.

boardgame.name: Bayhrst
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"A series of low stone walls divides and encircles the village. The village itself is a fairly typical, small farming village. The low stone wall is about chest high and is more for keeping livestock from wandering into town than it is to keep any serious enemies out. Bayhrst is somewhat off the beaten path and does not see a lot of trade. Its one and only claim to fame is the nearby battlefield called the Bone Fields. None of the locals will set foot onto the battlefield as there have been incidents in the past with a few restless dead and old magics still active. The townsfolk are growing increasingly worried about the activity and increased interest from strangers about the Bone Fields. People are spreading rumors and some folks are even thinking about leaving. Emotions are tense and fear is spreading through the town quickly."

boardgame.name: Catun
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Catun was once a toll station on the King's Road. The thorp is dominated by a single tall tower. Most of the town is made up of tents and other temporary dwellings though there are a few stout buildings left over from its days as a toll station. There are only three permanent structures in town the Tower, The Hunter and Mug tavern and inn and the pawn shop G&M's Artifacts and Relics.

It is governed by a corrupt aristocrat, the human lord Ered. Ered was exiled from the capitol for bribery and corruption. He was given this post as a reward for his "loyalty" and "dedication" to the king. Ered was too well connected to the council of Barons to be taken out and executed so he was
given this non-reward and he knows it. He constantly schemes to regain his position and is more than willing to hire some adventuring types, who don't ask a lot of questions, to do some morally ambiguous things. Ered lives in the tower and rarely shows himself to his "subjects"."

boardgame.name: Waham
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Waham is a sleepy farming village far off the beaten path. The village is dominated by a single tall tower. The tower has been locked for as long as anyone can remember and no one has ever been inside though many wandering adventurers have tried they have all failed. The local farmers no longer pay the old tower much notice except as a very large sun dial. The townsfolk have laid out carved stones around the open space that separates the Town from the Tower. When the tower's shadow falls onto the stones they will let anyone know what time it is.

There is a local legend surrounding the tower. It is said that it once was home to a powerful wizard who went off to fight some world shattering evil and never returned. Some in town say that the tower is full of arcane treasure while others contend that it is full of monsters and worse. Most townsfolk give the tower a wide berth out of superstition and fear."

boardgame.name: The Abandoned Dwarf Hold of Gundabar
Gundabar
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"Most of the thorp is delved into the sides of a rocky hill. From the road the two turrets of the gatehouse are carved from the rocky hillside and rise above it for a 360 degree view all around the area. The gatehouse has a large stout wooden door that appears to be locked and barred. A large iron door knocker hangs from one of the two doors.

It is governed by an arcane sorcerer, a male dwarf named Gari. Gari leads his small clan of dwarves who followed him back to their ancestral hold in order to recapture it from the Goblins and other evil creatures who over ran their ancestors many decades ago. The reconquest was going well when they ran into something they could not handle. Something was eating their kin deep in the dwarf hold and no dwarf who knows what lurks in the hold has survived to tell the tale of what lies in wait in the deep. Luckily for the dwarves there is an old fortified choke point between the cleared area that they inhabit and the rest of the abandoned hold. They hold the choke point against the occasional goblin incursion but the goblins have unknown numbers and an unknown ally powerful enough to destroy any dwarven incursion without leaving survivors."

boardgame.name: The Secret Tomb
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"The town of Wawold has seen better days. The town is a labyrinth of winding, narrow streets and dark alleys. It was once a thriving metropolis centered in a vast web like trading network until the gods intervened. The city had become decadent in its wealth and power. The money it accumulated through trade and business fed more than greed. It fed hubris. This vainglorious pride fueled discontent with the rule of the gods and their priests. Heresy, blasphemy and outright disrespect towards the gods made those immortal and inscrutable beings angry. In their anger the gods struck down a city numbering in the tens of thousands of souls. Famine, plague, fires, blindness, deafness and sudden horrifying deaths ravaged the city for weeks.

The City was laid to ruin and became a pariah. Those who sought reconciliation with the gods made their way to Wawold. Undead currently roam the old city by night making forcing the occupied portion of the city to create a defensive wall with heavily reinforced gates between the old ruins and the still occupied portions of the city. boardgame.name: Boom & Zoom (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
The rules are simple: each player has four towers, three pieces high, that can "boom" (fire) or "zoom" (move) a number of spaces equal to the tower's height. But with those deceptively simple ingredients, veteran designer Ty Bomba has created his masterpiece, the game that he himself acknowledges as his own best design. The trick is that the game ends when only one player's pieces remain on the board, and the player who managed to exit the most pieces off of the opponent's side of the map wins. Because of this, players can't concentrate on just blocking/attacking or just advancing, but must strike a difficult and subtle balance between the two.

The first edition of Mr. Bomba's game was significantly altered by its publisher. Here, all unnecessary ornamentation has been stripped away, presenting the designer's original vision as he had always intended, in a handsome format utilizing chunky 40mm x 40mm x 16mm wooden blocks.

boardgame.name: Hood's Last Gamble
boardgame.description:
1864. After some maneuvering in northern Georgia in an attempt to disrupt Sherman's supply line, John Bell Hood moved the Confederate Army of Tennessee westward and then to the north. George Thomas's Army of the Cumberland, which was dispersed but growing, stood in the way. Hood's plan had objectives such as defeating scattered Union armies, bringing in thousands of recruits from Tennessee, taking the city of Nashville, and after that even moving into Kentucky and beyond. These goals were optimistic in the face of Federal strength, but Hood was determined to gamble…

Hood's Last Gamble is an operational-level game for two players exploring the 1864 Franklin-Nashville Campaign. It shares some similarities with the designer's earlier games More Aggressive Attitudes and Objective Shreveport!, but has its own identity and flavor. This one has a larger map with many tricky terrain challenges and more Special Event Cards around which to build your strategy. It utilizes a streamlined approach to the tracking of unit Strength Points that reduces counter clutter and allows for more elegant hidden movement opportunities. Supply counters are crucial to getting the most out of your units, and with winter just around the corner, the Confederate Player must act quickly and decisively in order to change history.

boardgame.name: The Great Heathen Army
boardgame.description:
The fourth game in the Shields & Swords II series is also the largest, with more scenarios than the previous three games combined. The theme this time is the "mycel heathen here": the terrifying host of Vikings that landed in England not to loot and pillage, but to conquer. They were steadfastly resisted by Alfred the Great, King of Wessex, and three of Alfie's most famous battles are included. His descendents fought off Viking encroachments with varying degrees of success, until the victory of Canute in 1016. The battles are as follows:

Ashdown 871 - King Aethelred and his kid brother Alfred each command half of the army on either side of a causeway, squaring off against a Viking army likewise split in two. Basically two small battles fought side-by-side.

Marden 871 - The Saxons are favored to win until exhaustion sets in, giving the Vikings the chance to turn the tables.

Cynwit 878 - Vastly outnumbered Saxons leave their fort to launch a surprise attack against Viking besiegers; historically, the Saxons won the day and the Vikings were wiped out.

Ethandun 878 - Alfred's decisive victory over the Vikings. A big long battle with horsies and archers on both sides.

Wednesfield 910 - Vikings try to make their way across a river and to safety when they're attacked by the ferocious Aethelflaed of Mercia and her less-awesome baby brother, Edward the Elder.

Corbridge 918 - Constantine II, King of Scotland, defeats three Viking columns one after the other, when a hidden fourth column launches a sneak attack just before nightfall.

Maldon 991 - The story of Byhrtnoth and his "ofermode", which turned an easy victory into a defeat and a bloodbath. Didn't help that half his army ran away.

Assandun 1016 - A pre-game bid for the loyalty of the scheming Eadric Streona may prove decisive in this final clash between Canute the Great and Edmund Ironside.

boardgame.name: The Axe of Kardak
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The bear, distracted by his meal, did not notice Kardak until he had crept within a few dozen feet of the beast. Kardak's elk skin snow boots crunched along the ice and the enormous bear turned to face the half-starved barbarian. Kardak took off his thick gloves and hefted his un-blooded axe. The Great Ice Bear stood up and bellowed out a roar that shook the mountains in the distance. For the first time in his life Kardak felt the cold spear of fear in his gut. He pushed down the unfamiliar feeling and roared back his own challenge to the wall of fur and teeth before him.

His heart pounded like a blacksmith and his assistant hammering a block of freshly smelted steel. His ears roared with blood. His hands began to shake from the cold and from the fear. His eyes never left the great bear's deep black orbs though. The bear roared again, slobber and bits of whale-flesh flying from the terrible maw. The sound ripped through Kardak's heart but he stood firm, frozen to the ground. He stood his ground in the bitter cold and gusting wind. To run was to die. If he had to die, he would die with his axe buried in the flesh of this beast, the greatest of Ice Bears.

This PDF gives you the history, stats and powers for the Axe of Kardak.

The Golden Fang is a recent addition to the Civic Quarter and serves a very upscale clientele. There is music and entertainment every night and has become a popular destination for wealthy merchants and young nobles alike.

The Golden Fang is named after a local folk tale about a gold encrusted viper's fang worn as a necklace. One night, when the owner was removing it, the fang pricked his hand. The owner later died. The moral of the tale is to reinforce that just because something is pretty or valuable doesn't mean it isn't still dangerous. This describes the owner of the Golden Fang, Ana Renwood, to perfection. boardgame.name: Smalland
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.




Suddenly you have been shrunk.

Without knowing why, you found yourself in the world of small creatures. Why that's happened? Have all the humanity been shrunk or are you alone? There are so many questions that you should answer but before you do that, you must find a place to hide, because you didn't feed your sweet squirrel for a long time, and it's starving now.

With Smalland, lots of terms of survival have been changed and appeared quite a detailed game. The wind can blow your items, even your building if you didn't build it strong enough. The rain can be pretty dangerous, it can cause puddles. You're really small, and puddles are not just puddles anymore.

As a tiny person, there is a huge adventure that is waiting for you full of the lively ecosystem and great moments. You must be careful and craft creative items for staying alive in this crazy world. And if you want, your friends can join your adventure. With your help, we can make this project real.

CORE FEATURES

STRONG ECOSYSTEM
One of the most powerful features is having the really strong ecosystem. Animals have to survive just like you. They have to find a place and food and sometimes they become really dangerous for you. Ants can steal your items, you can be a meal for rabbits. Animals can kill each other and it may lead to an increase in animal populations. For now, we haven't implemented it for every animal yet. But we will.

HIGH-DETAILED WEATHER SYSTEM
In Smalland, The Weather is more than just a feature. As the weather conditions directly determine the behaviors of the animals, it makes nature incredible change. The Rain can turn the terrain into a pond. Weather conditions are important elements that you have to be really careful.

FLOOD SYSTEM
When it rains for a time, low or pitch surfaces can be flooded. How much it will damage depends on rain type and how long it happens. You should be sure about your building is not built on a low surface. For now, this system is not physical because of optimization issues but we want to improve this system and unfortunately, it's not possible without Indiegogo campaign.

WIND SYSTEM
If the wind is strong enough, it can blow so many things away. Your items, your building, even your body. So when you build something, you must choose the right place or make your building strong. You must deal with the wind. If you are outside, trees or giant things can be a lifesaver. And don't forget, you can make the wind your friend and you can have fun with it.

EIGHT-PLAYER CO-OP
Connect with your friends through an endless adventure and challenge that will test more than your skill! Check the leaderboard to see where you rank around the world. If you don't care the leaderboard, it's not a problem. Just have fun!

Source: The Game Website.

Smalland is as of July, 2019, taken over by Merge Games. More info forthcoming.

boardgame.name: Showtime
boardgame.description:
It's a well-known fact that with the wrong audience, any film can become a horror show. For the audience in Showtime! that wants to enjoy the offered blockbusters and score points, the right seating choice is the all-important factor. They want to avoid having tall men in front of them, children who are blowing bubbles in the middle of the row, or purses blocking neighboring seats. Many moviegoers also have certain preferences. They would like to sit together with their partner, be surrounded by men or women, or sit in the first row. One can only hope that before the start of a show, a riot doesn't break out and chase people away from their chosen seats. Whoever's visitors have had the most pleasure in the cinema after three rounds wins.

Showtime! (formerly called Film ab!) is an easily accessible, brisk family game with a funny theme that everyone knows from their everyday life. The clever placement mechanism and the different characters, each of whom one has likely encountered in the cinema, provide great entertainment at the game table.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description:
In 1918, newly independent Finland is in turmoil. The Senate and the Parliament are paralyzed, restless Russian troops are still stationed all over the country, and pro-government and revolutionary paramilitaries are clashing. The Senate flees the troubles from the capital to the north, while its army, the White Guard, starts to disarm Russian garrisons. At the same time in the capital, the People's Delegation declares a revolution and its Red Guard starts to seize power in southern Finland.

In more detail, 1918 is a two-player strategy game of the Finnish civil war. Players are in control of the pro-government Whites and the revolutionary Reds and their respective allies. All factions are unique with different kind of units, creating asymmetrical but balanced gameplay. The game has three scenarios, with different set-ups, objectives, and durations that depict different stages of war. In addition, there is the Grand Campaign, covering the whole war.

Rather than simulating mere fighting and battles, 1918 combines combat, type and quality of units, supply, casualties and fog of war into more complex warfare. On a strategic level, players have to create and maintain an army, keep an eye on the enemy, and secure their supply routes. On a operational level, players must take into account different kind of terrain and infrastructure affecting battles, in addition to their fighting forces.

All factions differ from one another. Factions also differ in every scenario or campaign, both by units available and the phase they come into play. Different objects of scenarios also change the entire way of playing with different sides.

Set-ups, units, and objectives of each scenario and the campaign are converted from real events and situations of the Finnish Civil War. Also each sides' support in the country, their means of support, and the infrastructure and the terrain are taken from respective real-life equivalents.

boardgame.name: Book It!: The Pro Wrestling Promoter Card Game
boardgame.description:
In the world of pro wrestling, the REAL cut-throat competition comes from the promoters of your favorite events! Take control of your own wrestling promotion. Choose your style, sign your wrestlers, develop local talent, boost your reputation, and sabotage your rivals! Think you've got what it takes to run the best pro wrestling company in the world? Well, then... BOOK IT!

In your quest to run the best pro wrestling company in the world, you're going to need to sign some talent! Fight with your competitors and try to book the talent that's going to best fit your promotion, increase your reputation, and make you the most money!

What type of promotion do you want to run? Do you prefer the flash and glitz of sports entertainment? The no-nonsense hard hitting strong style? The blood and guts of hardcore wrestling? The high-flying exclusive tradition of lucha libre? Or would you rather mix it all together and promote a hybrid style? You'll have to try to set yourself apart from your competition to make your name, so choose wisely!

What sort of fans are going to enjoy your promotion? Do you want to stay in one spot or take your show on the road? Choose what city best suits you... Or muscle in on your opponent's turf!

What type of person do you want to be? Promoters can choose to purchase cards that will give them special abilities or events, increasing their stock and maybe putting some extra coin in their back pocket.

They can ALSO spend money in an attempt to screw things up for their competitors! Mess with their bookings! Damage their ring! Hurt their advertising, and more! Be careful, though... Word tends to get around when someone is being a scumbag!

Put together all of these things and do your best to become the top promotion in the world!

boardgame.name: Mixed Signals: The Circuit Board Game
boardgame.description:
Mixed Signals: The Circuit Board Game is a game in which two players compete for the domination of a circuit board.

The players play as low and high voltage (or zeroes and ones if you prefer) and take turns placing triangular circuit tiles on the board. This in an effort to cause favorable voltage transitions in the circuit.

The goal for each player is to place all of their voltage tokens on the board by getting a majority of the circuit to carry their voltage. This is not as easy as it might sound since your opponent can and will hijack your sections of the circuit!

The game starts out with only two input tiles, one carrying a low voltage and one carrying a high voltage. Throughout the game, you will find signal mixing tiles and even new input tiles that make the game increasingly challenging, complex and fun!

boardgame.name: Vengeance: Big Boss and Gambling Dens
boardgame.description:
Big Boss Dens come into play when a Big Boss is discovered. Each gang have their own Big Boss Den that is designed for the abilities and flavor of that specific gang. Big Boss Dens are tough to beat, but reward the player with more victory points and wild tokens than even the toughest dens in a standard game of Vengeance.

Gambling Dens add a further challenge in your quest for vengeance in the form of fortified doors. Fortified doors make it harder to move through and block shooting for both you and the baddies. But for the deft ones that infilitrate them, there's more wild tokens to be had.

Big Boss and Gambling Dens increase the difficulty of a game of Vengeance while rewarding players if they overcome them.

boardgame.name: Goosebumps: The Card Game of Monster Mayhem
boardgame.description:
Goosebumps: The Card Game of Monster Mayhem is a furious battle between monsters. Giant Mantis versus Werewolf. Slappy versus the Mummy. This easy and fun card game uses different characteristics to determine which monster will come out on top. Features large oversized cards with art from the Scholastic books.

Shuffle the monster cards, Slappy card, and Mastermind card together and deal all 60 cards. All players place their cards face down in a draw pile in front of them.

The game is played in 6 rounds. In each round, players battle their monsters to win a trophy. Trophies are awarded in the same order as outlined on the monster cards. Ie: in round 1, players only use the Strength ability when battling each other.

Player 1 takes the top card from their draw pile, places the card face up on the table, and declares either “high” or “low”. All the other players flip over their top card and place them face up on the table. Players now battle by comparing their monster’s ability ratings. If “high” was declared, the monster with the highest rating wins the battle. If “low” was declared, the monster with the lowest rating wins the battle.

Both Slappy and Mastermind are special cards. They have a 1 or 9 rating for all abilities (depending on whether “high” or “low” is declared).

The player who wins the battle places all the cards from the battle into their winnings pile, and then takes the top card from their
draw pile and declares “high” or “low” for the next battle. Play continues in this manner until all the monsters have done battle and there are no monster cards left

When the round is over, players count the number of cards in their winnings pile. The player with the most cards wins the round, and collects the corresponding trophy card.

Repeat this process 5 more rounds for the remaining abilities and award trophy cards in the same manner.

The game ends when all 6 trophies have been won. The winner is the player with the most trophies.

La Stanza is a fast-paced board game in which players take the role of patrons of the arts sponsoring the most brilliant creators of the time and commissioning the best works of art, all while creating more wealth and increasing their social status and prestige.

On their turn, players move their "Patron" through the different rooms to recruit the characters that better serve their interest along the way. La Stanza is played in continuous rounds that result in dynamic turns and a challenging game play. Enlighten the new world and become the most prestigious patron of the Renaissance!

boardgame.name: Swordcrafters
boardgame.description:
The realm is defended, but the sword of protection is broken! The king has called on the best Swordcrafters to forge a replacement.

In Swordcrafters, players compete to forge the best sword scoring based on length, quality, and magic. Each round each player makes one cut in a grid of sword tiles to create a separation. After separations phase, each player selects one grouping of sword tiles and assembles them into their sword. When there are not enough sword tiles to form a new grid, scoring occurs.

Players hold their swords in the center of the table to score based on length. Sword quality scoring is based on the highest number of adjacent matching gems on one side of the sword. Sword magic scoring is based on the highest sum of two gem types.

A innovative 3D sword-building game where the player builds and holds their sword as they play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: CompoundIt!
boardgame.description:
CompoundIt! is a word game in which the “letters” are chemical elements and the “words” are compounds. The rules of the game strive to balance entertainment and playability, scientific accuracy, and educational value. The target audience includes students, science enthusiasts, nerds, and word game fans interested in learning an entirely new “language”. The style of play is familiar to those who have played other crossword-style board games, and the rules for compound formation come from chemistry itself.

Players make moves using a hand of ten tiles. Each tile is an element from the periodic table, although not every element is represented--only those found in relatively common compounds. A valid move creates a neutral compound with balanced charges. Compounds may be either binary (like carbon dioxide, methane, water, or ammonia) or involve polyatomic ions (sulfate, nitrate, hydroxide, etc.) Subsequent turns build new compounds using both new tiles and tiles already on the board. Players score points based on the point value of each tile (some elements are worth more than others), whether they are utilized in one direction or both horizontally and vertically, and whether they are played on special bonus squares. The game ends when one player runs out of tiles following the exhaustion of the general supply; at this time, the player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Brewin' USA: Taproom Takeover
boardgame.description:
The brewing industry in the USA is flourishing and taprooms are leading the way attracting customers to the site of creation for the ambitious new ales hitting the market.

Players compete to brew craft beer and fill their taproom with the best lineup of liquid gold. Taproom Takeover brings dice drafting to the world of Brewin' USA and adding new Breweries and beer cards that can play with the original Brewin' USA.

Draft an ingredient die or brew a beer if you have obtained the necessary ingredients. Stock your taproom quickly with the classic beer styles, or be the mad chemist and line the taps with experimental brews. When somebody has brewed 5 beers, the game ends and the highest score wins.

Players will also need to focus on expanding their taproom with more offerings to brew their 3rd, 4th, and 5th beer. A player may spend two dice showing the Tap facing to acquire a new beer tap. Each beer tap may have an action that the player may use on their turn as well as 1-2 beer styles and VP associated with each style.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: SheepDice: The Adventure
boardgame.description:
The sheep are restless… they want to go on an adventure!

SheepDice: The Adventure is a dice rolling game where the sheep are the dice. The flock of 21 sheep travel from one tile to the next until they make it back home… or not! Be a shepherd and help guide the sheep along, or be a wolf and catch them. The team with the most sheep wins!

The shepherd picks a sheep to roll, and based on the result, all matching sheep will move forward. The wolf rolls a group of sheep and catches one, but only if the wolf guesses a sheep type that ends up being alone. The tiles are double-sided and can be rearranged so you can have a different adventure every time.

Can be played in teams, cooperatively, or solo.

—description from the publisher
